museums.name: Denver Art Museum
museums.description: Founded in 1893 as the Denver Artists' Club, the Denver Art Museum has evolved into a major institution known for its extensive Indigenous Arts of North America collection, global art holdings, and distinctive architecture by Daniel Libeskind (originally designed for One World Trade Center). A cultural hub between Chicago and the West Coast, focusing on creativity and community learning.

lessons.title: What We've Been People
lessons.description: Contemporary photography exhibition exploring Indigenous identity and experience

lessons.title: Arts of Asia Galleries
lessons.description: Explore Buddhist art, including the Western Paradise Taima Mandala and Bodhisattva Guanyin

lessons.title: Andrea Carlson: Contemporary Indigenous Art
lessons.description: Works exploring Indigenous identity through contemporary painting including 'Cannibal Ferox' and 'The Tempest'

lessons.title: Painting the Andes
lessons.description: Colonial and post-colonial art from the Andes, featuring religious paintings and cultural fusion

lessons.title: A Century of Art in Latin America
lessons.description: Contemporary Latin American art including works by Diego Rivera, Carlos Mérida, and Tessa Mars

lessons.title: Photography Collection
lessons.description: Browse the museum's extensive photography holdings

lessons.title: Architecture and Design Collection
lessons.description: Explore architectural works and design objects

lessons.title: Latin American Art Collection
lessons.description: Browse works from across Latin America

lessons.title: European and American Art Before 1900
lessons.description: Classic works from European and American traditions

museums.name: Museo del Prado
museums.description: Spain's premier art museum, home to masterworks by Velázquez, Goya, El Greco, and more. Explore Spanish royal collections and European masterpieces.

lessons.title: Introduction to the Prado
lessons.description: Overview of the museum and its collections

lessons.title: The Female Perspective III: Queen Isabella Farnese
lessons.description: Exhibition exploring the art patronage and collecting of Queen Isabella Farnese, highlighting women's roles in shaping museum collections

lessons.title: Capilla Herrera
lessons.description: The Prado's chapel space featuring devotional art and religious works

lessons.title: The Lost Caravaggio: Ecce Homo Unveiled
lessons.description: Documentary on the recently discovered Caravaggio masterpiece (1606-1609). The Prado's collection connects to other Caravaggio works including the Kimbell's 'Judith Beheading Holofernes'

lessons.title: Ecce Homo Exhibition Montage
lessons.description: Behind-the-scenes look at mounting the Caravaggio exhibition

lessons.title: Power of Art: Caravaggio
lessons.description: Dramatic documentary exploring Caravaggio's revolutionary art and tumultuous life

lessons.title: Anton Raphael Mengs (1728-1779)
lessons.description: Exhibition on the German Neoclassical painter who worked extensively for Spanish royalty

lessons.title: Mengs Exhibition Montage
lessons.description: Short visual tour of the Mengs exhibition

lessons.title: Antonio Muñoz Degrain (1840-1924)
lessons.description: Spanish landscape and historical painter known for dramatic light effects

lessons.title: Muñoz Degrain: The Lovers of Teruel
lessons.description: Instagram session exploring 'The Lovers of Teruel' (1884) and landscape works

lessons.title: Jan Brueghel the Elder Collection
lessons.description: Browse works by 'Velvet' Brueghel, master of detailed landscapes and still lifes

lessons.title: Rubens and Brueghel Collaborations
lessons.description: Collaborative works between Peter Paul Rubens and Jan Brueghel, including 'The Sense of Hearing'

lessons.title: Velázquez Collection
lessons.description: Explore the Prado's unmatched collection of Diego Velázquez, including Las Meninas

lessons.title: The Crucified Christ by Velázquez
lessons.description: Analysis of Velázquez's powerful religious masterwork

lessons.title: Las Meninas: Main Figures and Space
lessons.description: Instagram session breaking down Velázquez's compositional genius in Las Meninas (1656)

lessons.title: Prado Timeline Explorer
lessons.description: Interactive timeline connecting artworks to historical events and monarchs

museums.name: Kimbell Art Museum
museums.description: Intimate museum featuring European masterworks in Louis Kahn's iconic architecture. Home to works by Caravaggio, Monet, Matisse, and more.

lessons.title: Matisse: L'Asie (1946)
lessons.description: Explore Matisse's vibrant Fauvist masterpiece celebrating color and form

lessons.title: Matisse: Life and Work
lessons.description: 48-minute documentary exploring Matisse's artistic journey and Fauvism

lessons.title: Claude Monet Exhibition
lessons.description: The Kimbell's Monet holdings including Water Lilies and Weeping Willow. Cross-reference with the Impressionism course for deeper context.

lessons.title: How Claude Monet Transformed French Painting
lessons.description: Documentary on Monet's revolutionary approach to light and color

museums.name: Museo de las Américas
museums.description: Founded in 1992, dedicated to presenting the history and cultures of the American continent with special emphasis on Puerto Rico. Housed in the historic Cuartel de Ballajá (1854-1864).

lessons.title: Museo de las Américas Introduction
lessons.description: Quick overview of the museum and its mission

lessons.title: Supporting Art and Community in Puerto Rico
lessons.description: Bloomberg Philanthropies feature on community engagement

lessons.title: Old San Juan's Cultural Jewel
lessons.description: Amateur walking tour of the museum

lessons.title: Las Artes Populares en Las Américas
lessons.description: Exhibition exploring traditional artistic expressions from across the Americas, highlighting cultural diversity rooted in Indigenous, European, African, and Asian influences

lessons.title: El Indígena de Las Américas
lessons.description: Explores Indigenous history and resilience, featuring Taíno culture and hyperrealistic sculptures by Felipe Lettersten. Puerto Rico holds evidence of human presence dating back 6,200 years.

lessons.title: 5 Indigenous Taíno Sites in Puerto Rico
lessons.description: Exploring archaeological sites and cultural heritage

lessons.title: Rediscovering the Taíno People
lessons.description: Documentary on Taíno history and cultural survival

lessons.title: La Herencia Africana
lessons.description: Explores the foundational role of African peoples in shaping Puerto Rico, from slavery's tragic history to extraordinary cultural contributions. Highlights West and Central African traditions.

lessons.title: Santos de Palo de Puerto Rico
lessons.description: Wooden religious sculptures rooted in Spanish colonial catechization, now a uniquely Puerto Rican artistic genre. Collection donated by Ricardo E. Alegría Gallardo and Carmen Ana Pons Castañer.

lessons.title: Dale Click a la Cultura: Santos de Palo Contemporáneos
lessons.description: Contemporary interpretations of the santos tradition

lessons.title: Santos de palo puertorriqueños: devoción, tradición, arte y cultura
lessons.description: In-depth conference on the santos tradition (long but comprehensive)

lessons.title: Reyes Magos en Carruaje - Artisan Wilzen Pérez
lessons.description: In Europe the Three Kings travel by camel, but in Puerto Rico they ride in legendary artisan carts

lessons.title: Conquest and Colonization
lessons.description: Six galleries exploring how Taíno, African, and Spanish cultures intersected to form Puerto Rican identity. Examines evangelization, colonial architecture, and strategic importance that led to attacks by Dutch, French, and English forces.

lessons.title: El Morro: Digital Reconstruction
lessons.description: History including digital geography and topography of nearby El Morro fortress (some minor inaccuracies but impressive digital recreations)

museums.name: The Louvre
museums.description: The world's most visited museum, home to the Mona Lisa, Venus de Milo, and countless masterworks spanning human history.

lessons.title: Coming Soon: Louvre Masterworks
lessons.description: Lessons on Mona Lisa, Venus de Milo, Wedding at Cana, and more masterpieces will be added soon!

museums.name: Impressionism
museums.description: Revolutionary movement that broke from academic tradition, capturing fleeting moments of light and color en plein air. Led by Monet, Renoir, Pissarro, and others.

lessons.title: Complete Impressionism Course
lessons.description: Comprehensive Udemy course on Impressionist art, history, and techniques
lessons.note: This course requires login. Use these credentials (you'll only need to enter them once on this device)

lessons.title: Vincent Van Gogh's The Starry Night
lessons.description: Great Art Explained: Deep dive into Van Gogh's masterpiece

lessons.title: Monet's Water Lilies
lessons.description: Great Art Explained: Understanding Monet's garden paintings

lessons.title: The Father of Impressionism: Édouard Manet
lessons.description: Great Art Explained: How Manet revolutionized painting

museums.name: Post-Impressionism
museums.description: Artists who built on Impressionism but pushed toward greater expression, structure, or symbolism. Includes Van Gogh, Cézanne, Gauguin, and Seurat.

lessons.title: Post-Impressionism: Van Gogh, Cézanne, Gauguin
lessons.description: Comprehensive Udemy course exploring the major Post-Impressionist masters
lessons.note: This course requires login. Use these credentials (you'll only need to enter them once on this device)

lessons.title: Reflections on Cézanne
lessons.description: In-depth lecture on Cézanne's artistic philosophy

lessons.title: Paul Cézanne: The Father of Modern Art
lessons.description: National Gallery lecture on Cézanne's 'The Bathers'

lessons.title: The Life of Paul Gauguin
lessons.description: From fraught friendships to French Polynesia

lessons.title: Georges Seurat: Pointillism and Color Theory
lessons.description: Great Art Explained: Understanding Seurat's scientific approach

museums.name: Surrealism
museums.description: Movement exploring dreams, the unconscious, and irrational juxtapositions. Led by Dalí, Miró, Magritte, and Frida Kahlo.

lessons.title: Surrealism: Dalí, Miró, and Frida Kahlo
lessons.description: Comprehensive Udemy course on Surrealist art and artists
lessons.note: This course requires login. Use these credentials (you'll only need to enter them once on this device)

lessons.title: The Case for Surrealism
lessons.description: Philosophical exploration of why Surrealism matters

lessons.title: Dada, Surrealism, and Symbolism
lessons.description: Crash Course Theater #37 - Great for students and adults alike!

lessons.title: Salvador Dalí: Master of Surrealism
lessons.description: Full biographical documentary

lessons.title: Joan Miró: Painter of Another Reality
lessons.description: Creator of a theatre of dreams

lessons.title: Frida Kahlo: A Life of Pain
lessons.description: Biographical documentary on Frida's life and art

lessons.title: Frida Kahlo's 'The Two Fridas'
lessons.description: Great Art Explained: Deep analysis of one masterwork

lessons.title: What This Painting Tells Us About Frida Kahlo
lessons.description: Exploring biography through art

lessons.title: Salvador Dalí: Great Art Explained
lessons.description: Analysis of Dalí's most famous works

lessons.title: René Magritte: Great Art Explained
lessons.description: Understanding Magritte's philosophical paintings
